title: IIM Calcutta MBA Admission: From CAT score to selection process, all you need to know before applying - Hindustan Times
summary:
IIM Calcutta MBA Admission: Everything You Need to Know for 2025-27

Date: Dec 25, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

IIM Calcutta has released its MBA admission policy for the 2025-27 cycle, outlining the eligibility criteria and selection process for candidates.

Key Points:

  • A valid Common Admission Test (CAT) score is mandatory for all applicants.
  • Eligibility criteria include a bachelor's degree with a minimum percentage of marks (50% for general, 45% for SC/ST/PwD).
  • Two-stage selection process: initial shortlist based on CAT percentiles followed by personal interviews and written ability tests.
  • The selection criteria weigh CAT score, academic performance, and diversity factors.

Notable Quotes:

IIM Calcutta mentioned that the actual section-wise and overall percentile cut-offs may be much higher than the minimum percentiles depending upon the number of candidates called for personal interview (PI).

For detailed admissions information, candidates can visit the official website.
newTitle: IIM Calcutta MBA Admission: Everything You Need to Know for 2025-27

title: HAL to start trial of new Tejas fighter jet in January next year - Hindustan Times
summary:
HAL to Begin Critical Trials of New Tejas Fighter Jet in January 2025

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) is set to start critical trials of the new Tejas light combat aircraft (LCA Mk-1A) in January 2025, targeting a March 31 deadline for delivery to the Indian Air Force (IAF).

  • Trials will involve testing the indigenous Astra missile, electronic warfare suite, and Israeli Elta radar.
  • HAL is negotiating with GE Aerospace for timely delivery of F404 engines, with production issues reportedly resolved.
  • The first few LCAs will be delivered with reserve engines and later upgraded with F404s.
  • Concerns have been raised about the pace of the LCA Mk-1A program impacting the IAF's combat effectiveness.
“HAL has the capability and capacity to catch-up in production once the F404 engines start coming in.”

With plans to operate around 350 LCAs in total, the IAF is prioritizing timely delivery to enhance its combat readiness.
newTitle: HAL to Begin Critical Trials of New Tejas Fighter Jet in January 2025

title: Proposal to name Mysuru road after Siddaramaiah evokes strong objections - Deccan Herald
summary:
Strong Objections to Naming Mysuru Road After Siddaramaiah

Date: 24 December 2024 Source: Deccan Herald

A proposal by the Mysuru City Corporation to name a road after Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has faced significant backlash from opposition parties and local activists.

  • The proposed road naming is for a stretch of KRS Road, which would be called 'Siddaramaiah Arogya Marga.'
  • The proposal arose from a suggestion by Congress MLA Harish Gowda and was discussed in a council meeting on November 22.
  • The JD(S) party criticized the proposal, citing Siddaramaiah's involvement in a corruption case.
  • RTI activist Snehamayi Krishna expressed public objections and threatened legal action if the proposal is enacted.
  • Siddaramaiah is currently under scrutiny due to allegations regarding the improper allotment of land.
“Naming a road after the 'corrupt' chief minister is a betrayal and insult.” - JD(S)

This proposal has sparked a significant discussion about the legacy and accountability of political figures, especially in light of ongoing allegations against Siddaramaiah.
newTitle: Strong Objections to Naming Mysuru Road After Siddaramaiah

title: From Attacks On Minorities To Hasina's Extradition Appeal: Irritants In India-Bangladesh Ties - News18
summary:
Irritants in India-Bangladesh Relations: From Minority Attacks to Extradition Appeals

Date: December 24, 2024

Source: News18

The interim government of Bangladesh, led by Muhammad Yunus, has been taking steps that escalate tensions with India instead of strengthening ties, following the ouster of Sheikh Hasina.

  • The Yunus government is communicating with the public that it is different from the previous administration.
  • Efforts to revive SAARC have been viewed with skepticism due to India’s concerns regarding the grouping.
  • Security reviews for travel from Pakistan to Bangladesh have been reduced.
  • There are increasing reports of violence against minorities in Bangladesh.
  • The Yunus government has requested India to extradite Sheikh Hasina, straining relations further.
“The actions of the Yunus government do not appear to be aligned with improving ties between the two neighbours.”

Despite tensions, India maintains an optimistic official position, emphasizing mutual trust, resolving each other’s concerns, and promoting trade between the countries.
newTitle: Irritants in India-Bangladesh Relations: From Minority Attacks to Extradition Appeals

title: Amit Shah pushes for use of tech to implement new criminal laws - The Times of India
summary:
Amit Shah Advocates for Technology in Implementing New Criminal Laws

Publication Date: [Insert Date] Source: [Insert Source]

Amit Shah emphasized the importance of utilizing technology to enhance the implementation of new criminal laws, aiming for efficient judicial processes.

  • The use of technology is expected to streamline case management and reduce delays in the justice system.
  • Shah highlighted the potential benefits of digital records and e-governance in the legal framework.
  • He called for collaboration between tech firms and law enforcement agencies.
  • The initiative aims to improve accessibility and transparency in the legal process.
“Technology is pivotal in modernizing our legal frameworks and ensuring quicker justice delivery,” stated Amit Shah.

This push for technology integration could lead to significant changes in how justice is administered in India, emphasizing efficiency and transparency.
newTitle: Amit Shah Advocates for Technology in Implementing New Criminal Laws

title: BJP, allies to put up unity show to mark Atal Bihari Vajpayee's birth centenary today - The Times of India
summary:
BJP, allies to put up unity show to mark Atal Bihari Vajpayee's birth centenary today

Date: Not specified | Source: Not specified

Today, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and its allies are organizing a special event to celebrate the birth centenary of Atal Bihari Vajpayee, former Prime Minister of India, showcasing unity among their ranks.

  • The event highlights Vajpayee's contributions to Indian politics and governance.
  • Senior leaders of the BJP are expected to attend, along with representatives from allied parties.
  • The program aims to reinforce the BJP's commitment to Vajpayee's vision for India.
“Vajpayee ji was a leader who united people across various sections of society.”

This event serves as a reminder of Vajpayee's legacy and the BJP's ongoing efforts to adapt his ideologies to contemporary governance.
newTitle: BJP and Allies Commemorate Atal Bihari Vajpayee's Birth Centenary

title: Tariffs, GDP path among key focus areas in PM pre-budget talks - Hindustan Times
summary:
Key Focus Areas in PM Modi's Pre-Budget Talks Include Tariffs and GDP

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi consulted economists about India's economic growth and global uncertainty ahead of the NDA government's second budget in its third term.

  • Key topics included jobs, education, and infrastructure.
  • The meeting's agenda was maintaining economic growth during global uncertainty.
  • Modi emphasized collaboration between government and private sectors to aim for a developed economy by 2047.
  • Discussions focused on employment generation and skill development.
  • Concerns about a mismatch in skills and job availability were highlighted.
  • The upcoming budget is expected to impact customs duties and local manufacturing incentives.
“There was a very broad, in-depth discussion on all aspects of India’s economy,” - Chetan Ghate, Institute of Economic Growth.

This consultative meeting is crucial for shaping policies that can address the economic challenges ahead, particularly related to maintaining growth in a volatile global landscape.
newTitle: Key Focus Areas in PM Modi's Pre-Budget Talks Include Tariffs and GDP

title: Former Union home secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla appointed Manipur governor; Arif Mohammed Khan new Bihar go - The Times of India
summary:
Former Union Home Secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla Appointed Manipur Governor; Arif Mohammed Khan New Bihar Governor

Publication Date: October 2023, Source: Times of India

Ajay Kumar Bhalla has been appointed as the new governor of Manipur, while Arif Mohammed Khan is set to take over as the governor of Bihar. This decision comes amidst various political shifts in the region.

  • Bhalla's career includes prominent roles in various governmental positions.
  • Khan has previously held significant roles in Indian politics.
  • The appointments are seen as strategic moves ahead of upcoming elections.
“These decisions reflect the central government's efforts to ensure stability in these crucial states.”

The new appointments are expected to impact the political landscape in Manipur and Bihar significantly.
newTitle: Former Union Home Secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla Appointed Manipur Governor; Arif Mohammed Khan New Bihar Governor

title: Congress releases 2nd list of 26 candidates for Delhi assembly polls - The Times of India
summary:
Congress releases 2nd list of 26 candidates for Delhi assembly polls

Publication Date: October 16, 2023  |  Source: Times of India

The Congress party has released its second list of candidates for the upcoming Delhi assembly elections, consisting of 26 names. This announcement comes as the party strategizes to strengthen its position in the capital.

  • The list includes several former MLAs aiming to reclaim their seats.
  • There are new faces added to the list, indicating a mix of experience and fresh perspectives.
  • The decision reflects Congress's efforts to revitalize its campaign ahead of the polls.
“We are committed to bringing back the Congress government in Delhi,” stated a senior party leader.

The announcement of the candidates is a strategic move by the Congress party as it seeks to regain influence in Delhi's political landscape. The upcoming elections present a crucial opportunity for the party to re-establish its presence amid stiff competition.
newTitle: Congress Unveils Second List of Candidates for Delhi Assembly Elections

title: Delhi: 8-year-old girl strangled to death for resisting rape by neighbourhood 'brother' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi: 8-Year-Old Girl Strangled to Death After Resisting Neighbor's Rape Attempt

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

In a shocking incident in Delhi's Vasant Vihar, an 8-year-old girl was strangled to death on Tuesday after resisting a rape attempt by a 19-year-old neighbor. The girl's body was found in a vacant house in Shankar Vihar Military Station with a noose around her neck.

  • The victim, who lived in the army servant quarters, had been missing since Monday.
  • The accused, a 19-year-old youth from the same neighborhood, was arrested with the help of CCTV footage.
  • During interrogation, the accused confessed to luring the girl to an isolated house and attempting to rape her. When she resisted, he strangled her and tried to make it look like suicide.
  • The girl is survived by her parents and an elder brother.
The accused also tried to mislead the police by tying a scarf around her neck and trying to pass it off as a case of suicide.

The family members and other residents held a protest demanding justice for the victim and her family. The police have added sections of murder and others to the FIR.
newTitle: Delhi Shock: 8-Year-Old Girl Strangled to Death After Resisting Neighbor's Rape Attempt

title: NFRA penalises Deloitte for alleged lapses in ZEEL audit, debars two partners | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
NFRA penalises Deloitte for alleged lapses in ZEEL audit, debars two partners

Publication Date: December 23, 2023

Source: Mint

The National Financial Reporting Authority (NFRA) has imposed penalties and debarments on Deloitte and two of its partners for professional misconduct during their audits of Zee Entertainment Enterprises Limited (ZEEL) for two financial years.

This ruling involves severe penalties totaling ₹2.15 crore against Deloitte and accusations of missing significant irregularities, including the mishandling of a ₹200-crore fixed deposit by ZEEL.

  • NFRA imposed a ₹2 crore penalty on Deloitte and debarred one partner for five years with a ₹10 lakh fine.
  • The second partner has been debarred for three years with a ₹5 lakh penalty.
  • The actions stem from Deloitte's failure to report irregularities regarding ZEEL’s fixed deposit held with Yes Bank.
  • The ordinance highlights a lack of professional skepticism from the auditors.
“Auditors did not exercise professional skepticism and were grossly negligent in the audit of the matter related to FD closure,” - NFRA

The NFRA's actions reflect the importance of rigorous auditing standards and accountability in financial reporting.
newTitle: NFRA Penalizes Deloitte for Audit Misconduct in ZEEL Case

title: Pushpa 2 box office collection day 20: Allu Arjun questioned over stampede case even as film inches towards ₹1100 cr - Hindustan Times
summary:
Pushpa 2 box office collection day 20: Allu Arjun questioned over stampede case even as film inches towards ₹1100 cr

Date: Dec 25, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses the ongoing success of Pushpa 2: The Rule at the box office as it nears ₹1100 crores while Allu Arjun faces questioning regarding a tragic stampede incident linked to the film's premiere.

  • Pushpa 2 has accumulated ₹1089.51 crore in India after 20 days.
  • The film's single day collection on its third Tuesday is ₹14.25 crore.
  • It achieved ₹725.8 crore in its first week and ₹264.8 crore in its second week.
  • The film crossed ₹1500 crore worldwide, according to its producers.
  • Allu Arjun appeared before the Hyderabad police in relation to the stampede investigation.
“The producers donated ₹50 lakh to the family of the stampede victim.”

This ongoing situation highlights the interplay between commercial success and public safety considerations within the film industry.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 Box Office Collection: Allu Arjun Questioned Over Stampede

title: Allu Arjun Quizzed, His Bouncer Arrested; Actor Likely To Be Taken To Pushpa 2 Stampede Spot Soon - News18
summary:
Allu Arjun Quizzed After Pushpa 2 Screening Stampede

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: News18

Top Telugu actor Allu Arjun was questioned by the Chikkadpally police in connection with a woman's death during a stampede at a movie screening in Hyderabad. He was arrested earlier but granted bail.

  • Allu Arjun was grilled for four hours regarding the December 4 stampede incident during the screening of ‘Pushpa-2’.
  • His bouncer, identified as the organizer at the Sandhya Theatre, was also arrested.
  • Police are set to recreate the scene at the theater with Allu Arjun and his bouncer.
  • The investigation follows claims made by Allu Arjun in a press conference where he defended his actions during the screening.
  • A total of eleven accused have been named in the case, and social media videos of the incident have surfaced.
“There is a lot of misinformation that I behaved in a particular way (irresponsibly). These allegations are wrong. It’s humiliating and a character assassination.” - Allu Arjun

This incident has sparked public outcry and political reactions, with calls for accountability surrounding crowd control measures during events.
newTitle: Allu Arjun Quizzed After Pushpa 2 Screening Stampede

title: Rajendra Arlekar is new Kerala Governor; Arif Mohammed Khan moved to Bihar - Onmanorama
summary:
Rajendra Arlekar appointed as new Kerala Governor; Arif Mohammed Khan moves to Bihar

Published: December 24, 2024 10:03 PM IST Source: Onmanorama

The President of India has appointed Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar as the new Governor of Kerala, replacing Arif Mohammed Khan who will assume the governorship of Bihar.

  • Rajendra Arlekar was previously the Governor of Himachal Pradesh.
  • Arlekar has also served as a Cabinet minister and Speaker of the Goa Legislative Assembly.
  • Other gubernatorial appointments include new governors for Manipur, Mizoram, and Odisha.
“These appointments will take effect from the dates they assume their respective offices.”

This change in governance comes ahead of the Assembly polls scheduled for Bihar next year, highlighting the government's strategy for regional administration.
newTitle: Rajendra Arlekar appointed as new Kerala Governor; Arif Mohammed Khan moves to Bihar

title: Ajay Bhalla named new Manipur Governor; Arif Mohammed Khan shifted to Bihar - The Hindu
summary:
Ajay Bhalla named new Manipur Governor; Arif Mohammed Khan shifted to Bihar

Published on: December 24, 2024 10:02 pm IST

The appointment of Ajay Kumar Bhalla, former Union Home Secretary, as the new Governor of Manipur is noteworthy given the ongoing ethnic strife between the Meitei community and Kuki tribes since May 2023. His significant experience in the Home Ministry positions him well for this role.

  • Ajay Kumar Bhalla has been appointed as the new Governor of Manipur.
  • Former Union Minister General V. K. Singh is now the Governor of Mizoram.
  • Arif Mohammed Khan has been reassigned from Kerala to Bihar as Governor.
  • The appointment comes amid ongoing ethnic violence in Manipur, which has resulted in over 250 deaths.
  • Bhalla has a background in key legislations, including the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, during his tenure as Home Secretary.
"The violence in the Northeastern State has claimed more than 250 lives so far."

This appointment reflects significant political maneuvers, particularly with the shift of Arif Mohammed Khan, highlighting the evolving governance landscape in these states.
newTitle: Ajay Bhalla appointed as Manipur Governor amid ethnic strife

title: 5 soldiers killed as Army vehicle falls into 300-feet gorge in J&K's Poonch - The Times of India
summary:
5 Soldiers Killed as Army Vehicle Falls into 300-Feet Gorge in J&K's Poonch

Publication Date: October 2, 2023

Source: Times of India

A tragic accident occurred in the Poonch region of Jammu and Kashmir, where an army vehicle plunged into a 300-feet gorge, resulting in the deaths of five soldiers.

  • The incident happened during a routine movement in the area.
  • Rescue operations were launched promptly, but the soldiers' injuries were severe.
  • The army has expressed deep condolences to the families of the deceased.
  • Authorities are investigating the circumstances surrounding the accident.
“The army is conducting an inquiry to ascertain the cause of the accident,” an official stated.

This unfortunate event highlights the risks faced by military personnel during their operations and the importance of ensuring their safety while on duty.
newTitle: 5 Soldiers Killed in Tragic Vehicle Accident in J&K's Poonch

title: President announces governors for 5 states: Kerala’s Arif Mohammed Khan reassigned to Bihar, Ajay Kumar Bhalla to take charge of Manipur - The Indian Express
summary:
President announces governors for 5 states: Kerala’s Arif Mohammed Khan reassigned to Bihar, Ajay Kumar Bhalla to take charge of Manipur

Date: Tuesday

Source: The Indian Express

In a significant reshuffle, President Droupadi Murmu appointed two new governors and reassigned three others, reorganising the leadership in five states.

  • Ajay Kumar Bhalla appointed as the new Governor of Manipur, replacing Anusuiya Uikey, amid ethnic conflict.
  • Arif Mohammed Khan reassigned from Kerala to Bihar, following previous tensions with the state government.
  • Hari Babu Kambhampati moved from Mizoram to Odisha.
  • General (Dr.) Vijay Kumar Singh appointed as Governor of Mizoram.
  • Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar reassigned from Bihar to Kerala.
“The conflict remains unresolved, leaving governance in disarray.”

This reshuffle marks a significant change in the administration amid ongoing challenges in several states.
newTitle: President reshuffles governors in five states including Kerala and Manipur

title: Ajay Kumar Bhalla, ex-Union home secretary, appointed new Manipur governor - Hindustan Times
summary:
Ajay Kumar Bhalla appointed as the new Governor of Manipur

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Former Union home secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla has been appointed as the new Governor of Manipur, replacing Laxman Prasad Acharya, according to an official order from Rashtrapati Bhavan.

  • Ajay Kumar Bhalla, a 1984 batch IAS officer, served as the Union home secretary until August 2024.
  • He had the longest tenure in the pivotal role of Union home secretary, starting in August 2019.
  • The recent reshuffle also includes the appointment of new governors for other states, including Arif Mohammed Khan as Bihar governor.
“Bhalla has had the longest tenure in the crucial post considered next to the country's top bureaucrat.”

This appointment comes amidst a series of gubernatorial changes in various states, aiming at better governance and administration.
newTitle: Ajay Kumar Bhalla appointed as the new Governor of Manipur

title: Congress cries foul over NHRC appointments: Read who are Justices Rohinton, Joseph, Muralidhar and Qureshi, whose names were recommended by Rahul and Kharge - OpIndia
summary:
Congress Criticizes NHRC Appointments Amid Controversy

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: Various

On December 23, 2024, President Droupadi Murmu appointed retired Justice V Ramasubramanian as the Chairperson of the NHRC, along with two members. The Congress party has raised concerns over the selection process, calling it predetermined.

Key Points:

  • Justice V Ramasubramanian appointed as NHRC Chairperson with Priyank Kanoongo and Bidyut Ranjan Sarangi as members.
  • Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge criticized the selection process as flawed.
  • The dissent letter cites a lack of consultation and claims the process ignored diversity concerns.
  • Gandhi and Kharge recommended Justices Rohinton Nariman and K M Joseph, citing their qualifications and representation of marginalized communities.
  • They argue that the NHRC's credibility relies on representing India's diversity.
“The selection process was fundamentally flawed. This departure undermines the principles of fairness and impartiality.” - excerpt from dissent letter by Gandhi and Kharge

Conclusion

The Congress's proposal of controversial figures brings into question their commitment to judicial impartiality and the strengthening of institutions.
newTitle: Congress Criticizes NHRC Appointments Amid Controversy

title: Local staff working at inoperative Indian consulate in Afghanistan injured - The Times of India
summary:
Local staff injured at inactive Indian consulate in Afghanistan

Date: October 2023
Source: Times of India

Recent reports indicate that local staff working at the Indian consulate in Afghanistan have sustained injuries amidst ongoing tensions in the region.

  • The consulate has been inactive for some time due to security concerns.
  • Local personnel were present at the site when the incident occurred.
  • This incident underscores the precarious situation facing foreign diplomatic missions in Afghanistan.
"The security of our staff remains a top priority, and we are assessing the situation closely." - Indian Foreign Ministry

In conclusion, as the situation evolves, the safety of local staff remains critical while reflecting on the broader implications for diplomatic missions in unstable regions.
newTitle: Local staff injured at inactive Indian consulate in Afghanistan

title: Tungsten block: Centre tells Tamil Nadu to keep Letter of Intent to Hindustan Zinc on hold - The Hindu
summary:
Centre advises Tamil Nadu to pause Hindustan Zinc's tungsten block bid

Published: December 24, 2024 - Source: The Hindu

The Union Ministry of Mines has requested a re-examination of the Nayakkarpatti tungsten block in Madurai, due to concerns over its biodiversity heritage site status, temporarily halting the issuance of the Letter of Intent to Hindustan Zinc Limited.

  • The Nayakkarpatti tungsten block includes six villages, notably Arittapatti, recognized for its archaeological significance.
  • The Geological Survey of India has been asked to reconsider the boundaries of the block to protect the biodiversity site.
  • The Tamil Nadu government initially notified the existence of the biodiversity site but did not oppose the auction process.
  • Concerns raised from local representations prompted the Ministry to take action.
  • Since being given the power to auction, Tamil Nadu has not auctioned any major mineral blocks in the past nine years.
“When the block was initially put up for auction in February 2024, till the auction result was declared on November 7, 2024, there was no communication from the State government regarding any opposition or concerns about the auction.”

The decision to hold off the auction highlights growing concerns over environmental protection in mining activities in Tamil Nadu.
newTitle: Centre advises Tamil Nadu to pause Hindustan Zinc's tungsten block bid

title: Ex Bureaucrat Ajay Bhalla New Manipur Governor, Mizoram Gets Ex Army Chief VK Singh - NDTV
summary:
Ajay Bhalla Appointed as New Manipur Governor, VK Singh Takes Charge in Mizoram

Publication Date: Tuesday evening

Source: National News

Ajay Kumar Bhalla has been appointed as the new Governor of Manipur amidst ongoing tensions between the Meitei community and Kuki tribes. VK Singh, a retired army chief, will now govern Mizoram. Additionally, there have been changes in governance for the states of Kerala and Bihar.

  • Ajay Kumar Bhalla replaces Anusuiya Uikey in Manipur.
  • VK Singh has been appointed as the Governor of Mizoram.
  • Arif Mohammed Khan and Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar exchanged governorships between Kerala and Bihar.
  • Raghubar Das resigned as the Governor of Odisha, succeeded by Dr Hari Babu Kambhampati.
“A governor is the constitutional head of a state and has similar powers and functions at the state level as those of the President of India at the central level.”

The recent appointments may influence ongoing tensions in Manipur and establish a new governance dynamic in Mizoram.
newTitle: Ajay Bhalla Appointed as New Manipur Governor, VK Singh Takes Charge in Mizoram

title: Opposition used ‘rusted knife’: Dhankhar breaks silence on attempt to remove him - The Tribune India
IIM Raipur breaks away from Common Admission Process - The Hindu
summary:
IIM Raipur Breaks Away from Common Admission Process

Published on: December 24, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Raipur has announced its decision to opt out of the Common Admission Process (CAP) 2025, which is a collaborative admission process among several second-generation IIMs. The institute will independently assess candidates based on CAT scores coupled with group discussions and personal interviews.

  • IIM Raipur will no longer participate in the CAP alongside IIM Nagpur, Bodh Gaya, Jammu, Kashipur, Ranchi, Sirmaur, Tiruchirappalli, and Udaipur.
  • The selection process will mirror that of older IIMs like Ahmedabad, Calcutta, Bangalore, and Kozhikode.
  • The change comes due to concerns about candidate quality when relying on a collective selection process.
  • Physical interviews will be held in eight cities, and expenses are projected to increase from ₹30 lakh to ₹3 crore.
  • IIM Raipur aims to cultivate an entrepreneurial mindset among its candidates.
  • Last year, candidates were admitted with a minimum cut-off of 90 percentile, and significant offers are expected again in 2025.
“We feel that independent evaluation is necessary to attract candidates with an entrepreneurial mindset.” - Ram Kumar Kakani, Director of IIM Raipur
newTitle: IIM Raipur Breaks Away from Common Admission Process

title: Five soldiers killed as vehicle falls into gorge in Poonch; Army rules out terror angle - The Hindu
summary:
Five Soldiers Killed as Vehicle Falls into Gorge in Poonch; Army Rules Out Terror Angle

Published on: December 24, 2024 | Source: PTI

Five soldiers were killed and five injured when their vehicle skidded off the road in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district.

  • The accident occurred in the Pir Panjal Valley, specifically in the Gharoa area.
  • The vehicle was part of a convoy en route from Nilam Headquarters to Balnoi Ghora Post.
  • Initial reports suggest the driver may have lost control at a curve in the road.
  • The vehicle fell into a gorge approximately 300-350 feet deep.
  • Rescue operations are ongoing, and the injured personnel are receiving medical care.
  • The Army has ruled out any terrorist involvement in this incident.
“I pay my heartfelt tribute to the martyrs and hope for the speedy recovery of the injured soldiers. My deepest condolences to the bereaved families.” - Rahul Gandhi

This tragic accident has drawn condolences from various political leaders, including Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah, who expressed sorrow over the loss of life.
newTitle: Five Soldiers Killed in Poonch Vehicle Accident; Army Rules Out Terrorism

title: Five soldiers die in accident in J&K’s Poonch: Army - The Hindu
summary:
Five Soldiers Die in Vehicle Accident in Poonch, J&K

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Five soldiers were killed on December 24, 2024, in a vehicle accident while on operational duty in Poonch district of Jammu and Kashmir.

  • The accident occurred in the Pir Panjal valley.
  • Preliminary reports indicate that at least seven soldiers were onboard.
  • The vehicle was traveling from Nilam headquarters to a post at Balnoi Ghora.
  • Rescue operations are ongoing, and injured personnel are receiving medical care.
“Five brave soldiers lost their lives in a vehicle accident during operational duty in the Poonch sector.” - Army Spokesman

This tragic incident highlights the dangers faced by military personnel during operational duties.
newTitle: Five Soldiers Die in Vehicle Accident in Poonch, J&K

title: Spiritual content creator Abhinav Arora opens up on trolling, his chicken video: ‘I can’t go to school…' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Spiritual Content Creator Abhinav Arora Talks About Trolling and School Challenges

Date: Dec 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

10-year-old Abhinav Arora, known as 'Bal Sant', speaks out on the challenges he faces due to online trolling, affecting his ability to attend school.

  • Abhinav is facing trolling and cyberbullying, preventing him from attending school regularly.
  • He currently visits school only for exams but desires both school and spiritual education.
  • His father highlighted Abhinav's aspirations to attend 'Gurukul' for spiritual studies.
  • Abhinav clarified his 'chicken video' controversy, asserting he is pure vegetarian.
  • His title 'Bal Sant' was given by followers out of love, not as a self-identification.
“I go to school... currently, I am not going to school due to trolling.” - Abhinav Arora

In conclusion, Abhinav Arora's experiences with trolling underscore the challenges faced by young content creators in today's digital landscape.
newTitle: Spiritual Content Creator Abhinav Arora Talks About Trolling and School Challenges

title: Union Home Minister Amit Shah reviews implementation of three criminal laws - The Hindu
summary:
Amit Shah Reviews Implementation of New Criminal Laws in Uttarakhand

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Union Home Minister Amit Shah held a meeting to assess the implementation of three new criminal laws in Uttarakhand, stressing the importance of technology and timely investigations.

  • Shah reviewed the implementation status with the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB).
  • He emphasized generating alerts for criminal cases to expedite investigations.
  • Shah demanded full implementation of the laws as soon as possible.
  • He advocated for the use of more forensic vans in every district.
  • Regular monitoring of Zero FIRs and transfer of cases has been stressed.
“There should be regular and continuous monitoring of how many of the total Zero FIRs registered have been brought to justice.”

In conclusion, the implementation of these laws is critical for justice enhancement in Uttarakhand, and the Home Minister is pushing for swift action and technological upgrades.
newTitle: Amit Shah Reviews Implementation of New Criminal Laws in Uttarakhand

title: PM Modi stresses fundamental change in the mindset for Viksit Bharat - Business Standard
summary:
PM Modi stresses fundamental change in the mindset for Viksit Bharat

Date: Not specifiedSource: Not specified

Ahead of the presentation of the Budget for FY26, Prime Minister Narendra Modi engaged with economists focusing on maintaining India's growth amidst global uncertainties. He emphasized that achieving Viksit Bharat requires a fundamental change in mindset aimed at making India developed by 2047.

  • Meeting included discussions on global economic challenges and strategies for enhancing employment, especially for youth.
  • Participants highlighted the importance of aligning education with job market demands.
  • There were discussions on improving agricultural productivity, rural employment, and attracting private investment.
  • Conversations also revolved around skilling, vocational education, and integrating into global markets.
  • Prominent economists attended, sharing insights for actionable policies to sustain growth in an uncertain environment.
“Our mandate was to discuss actionable policies to help sustain India’s growth momentum in an increasingly uncertain geopolitical and economic environment.” - Pritam Banerjee

This meeting aimed to develop strategies that align India's growth with evolving economic challenges, ensuring the country's economic stability and growth potential for the future.
newTitle: PM Modi emphasizes a change in mindset for Viksit Bharat by 2047
